newsitem.title: USA: Planet Polymer in venture with Israeli co.
newsitem.headline: Planet Polymer in venture with Israeli co.

text.p: Planet Polymer Technologies Inc said Sunday it has an agreement to enter into a joint venture with Environmental Services Co (Ramat Hovav) Ltd to market and manufacture Planet's environmental products and processes throughout Israel and neighboring regions.
Environmental Services is a company under the guidance of the Israeli Ministry of Environment.

Under their memorandum of understanding, Environmental Services would own 50 percent of the joint venture and contribute the initial financial capital required through the first year of commercialization.
Planet Polymer would own the other 50 percent and would contribute technological and scientific expertise, marketing collateral and technical support, it said.
The scope of the joint venture and the level of funding and other resources involved are still being explored by the two companies.
Environmental Services was founded in 1990 and manages the hazardous wastes treatment center at Ramat Hovav under the guidance of the Ministry of Environment.
